text: Ava Marie DuVernay (; born August 24, 1972) is an American filmmaker. For her work on Selma (2014), DuVernay became the first black woman to be nominated for a Golden Globe Award for Best Director, and also the first black female director to have her movie nominated for the Academy Award for Best Picture. In 2017, she was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature for her movie 13th (2016). DuVernay's 2018 Disney children's fantasy movie A Wrinkle in Time made her the first black woman to direct a live-action movie earning $100 million at U.S. box office. ==References== Category:American Emmy Award winners Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:Movie directors from California Category:Movie producers from California Category:Screenwriters from California Category:Writers from Long Beach, California
title: Ava DuVernay
